How it works:  1. Nothing is available before `startTime`.  2. Starting at `startTime`, `initialAmount` becomes immediately available.  3. Beyond that, tokens accrue linearly at `amountPerSecond`.  4. The total unlocked is capped by `maxAmount`.  5. The enforcer tracks how many tokens have already been spent, and will revert     if an attempted transfer exceeds what remains afterAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,b.details: This function MUST revert if the conditions are not met.

params._args: An optional input parameter set by the redeemer at time of invocation.
params._mode: The mode of execution for the executionCalldata.
params._redeemer: The address that is redeeming the delegation.
params._terms: The terms to enforce set by the delegator.

afterHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byte.details: This function MUST revert if the conditions are not met.

params._args: An optional input parameter set by the redeemer at time of invocation.
params._mode: The mode of execution for the executionCalldata.
params._redeemer: The address that is redeeming the delegation.
params._terms: The terms to enforce set by the delegator.

beforeAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,.details: This function MUST revert if the conditions are not met.

params._args: An optional input parameter set by the redeemer at time of invocation.
params._mode: The mode of execution for the executionCalldata.
params._redeemer: The address that is redeeming the delegation.
params._terms: The terms to enforce set by the delegator.

beforeHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byt.details: This function will revert if the transfer amount exceeds the available streaming allowance.

params._delegationHash: The hash of the delegation being operated on.
params._executionCallData: The transaction the delegate might try to perform.
params._mode: The execution mode. (Must be Single callType, Default execType)
params._terms: 148 packed bytes where: - 20 bytes: ERC20 token address. - 32 bytes: initial amount. - 32 bytes: max amount. - 32 bytes: amount per second. - 32 bytes: start time for the streaming allowance.

params._delegationHash: The hash of the delegation being queried.
params._delegationManager: The address of the delegation manager.

returns.availableAmount_: The number of tokens that are currently spendable under this streaming allowance (capped by `maxAmount`).

params._terms: 148 packed bytes where: - 20 bytes: ERC20 token address. - 32 bytes: initial amount. - 32 bytes: max amount. - 32 bytes: amount per second. - 32 bytes: start time for the streaming allowance.

returns.amountPerSecond_: The rate at which the allowance increases per second.
returns.initialAmount_: The initial amount available at startTime.
returns.maxAmount_: The maximum total unlocked tokens (hard cap)
returns.startTime_: The timestamp from which the allowance streaming begins.
returns.token_: The address of the ERC20 token contract.

afterAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,b.notice: Enforces conditions after all actions in a batch redemption process have been executed.

afterHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byte.notice: Enforces conditions after the execution tied to a specific delegation in the redemption process.

beforeAllHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,.notice: Enforces conditions before any actions in a batch redemption process begin.

beforeHook(bytes,bytes,bytes32,bytes,byt.notice: Hook called before an ERC20 transfer is executed to enforce streaming limits.

getAvailableAmount(address,bytes32).notice: Retrieves the current available allowance for a specific delegation.

getTermsInfo(bytes).notice: Decodes the terms used in this CaveatEnforcer.
